I was 16 when the first game came out\, and now I'm 23. And let me say\, it was worth the wait. The Last of Us Part II gives you raw emotion\, human nature\, flawless combat and a story that fills a void you didn't know was there. The themes are brutal in nature\, with the root being forgiveness and revenge. The combat is smooth\, seamless and has many different options - including the new prone feature to allow you to hide in long grass and under vehicles. The story is hard to play\, leaves you wanting more\, but is absolutely fulfilling on both ends. It really does show you how hate can consume you\, and that forgiveness is the true route to freeing yourself of that consumption. This game is\, without a doubt\, a must play.
